Isn't there a plugin for Firefox that enables you to be taken to a new tab with the Compose mail feature whenever you press a mailaddress on a site??
there is no builtin mail in Firefox. You can set an external mail handler with the network.protocol-handler.app.mailto config.
How do i find that little cousin???
in Firefox's location bar type 'about:config', press enter and then use the search bar shown to lookup 'mail'.
Hate to tell you this but i cannot find a "mail" anywhere
did you type - about:config - in the lookup bar?
then did you see the "Filter:" bar?
when you type 'mail' in the filter it pulls up nothing?
Something about GTDGMAIL, which is to be removed next time i strat firefox but nothin else.
hmmm, I guess I added that by hand here. Let me get the details for you.
ok, what I did was create a new file in my Firefox settings folder (~/.mozilla/firefox/<junkstring>.default/) called 'user.js'.
then I put this line in that file: user_pref("network.protocol-handler.app.mailto","/usr/bin/kmail");
of course you will want to change "/usr/bin/kmail" to YOUR mail handler.
you're welcome. IIRC I found out how to do that using an AltaVista web search.
